20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.title: Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence
20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.description:
In this week’s episode of The Learning Curve, co-hosts Alisha Searcy and Massachusetts civics teacher Kelley Brown interview Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jack Rakove, Coe Professor Emeritus at Stanford University. Prof. Rakove explores the origins of the American Revolution and U.S. Constitution through the lives of the nation’s Founding Era figures. Reflecting on young John Adams’ vivid depiction of his schoolhouse in colonial Massachusetts, Rakove offers context for the political and social landscape of the 18th-century America.

The post Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

4397d45805633839103771afc1f3eaf168ee5ade.description:
The Virginia Institute for Public Policy has expressed concern over HJ6007, a proposed amendment to Virginia’s Constitution that would alter the state’s current redistricting process. Citing constitutional and procedural issues surrounding HJ6007, the Institute encourages lawmakers to uphold established safeguards that protect the integrity and balance of Virginia’s electoral system.

9f4dac71b10c0dc6ce86531f1b559bab643b202c.title: In Case You Missed It: WILL Raised Key Voter Roll Concerns Ahead of DOJ Lawsuit
9f4dac71b10c0dc6ce86531f1b559bab643b202c.description:
The U.S. Department of Justice has filed a lawsuit against the Wisconsin Election Commission’s (WEC) for refusing to comply with their investigation into the state’s voter rolls. The request from USDOJ was for a copy of Wisconsin’s computerized registration list including information necessary to audit the list for ineligible voters, including driver’s license number and/or the last 4 digits of the social security number. The lawsuit also comes after an investigation from our organization released earlier this year.

The post In Case You Missed It: WILL Raised Key Voter Roll Concerns Ahead of DOJ Lawsuit appeared first on Wisconsin Institute for Law & Liberty.

9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.title: A Decade in the Making, a Reform Worth Protecting
9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.description:
Iowa’s 3.8% flat tax is the culmination of a decade-long reform effort, beginning in 2018, made possible by conservative budgeting, spending restraint, and structural tax reforms, not a one-time tax cut or temporary policy experiment. A flat tax is fairer, simpler, and more transparent than a progressive system, treating taxpayers equally under a single rate while preserving deductions and credits that protect lower-income households. To preserve its economic and fiscal benefits, Iowa’s flat tax must be constitutionally protected, ensuring long-term competitiveness, predictable budgeting, and preventing future legislatures from reversing course with higher progressive or wealth taxes.

The post A Decade in the Making, a Reform Worth Protecting appeared first on ITR Foundation.
